comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0
Build ID: 20110622232440

Steps to reproduce:

Open a new tab.
Start to type in address of site, until autocomplete found it
Press [ENTER]


Actual results:

Browser closed new tab, and jumped to a different tab with the same address


Expected results:

Browser should open the page in the active tab, when I typed

Are you sure you are not accidentally selecting the "Switch to tab" feature?

I don't know.

I'm typing the first few characters of the address and pressing [ENTER]

What is the "Switch to tab" feature?
comments.creator: sutton@bcs.org
comments.author: sutton@bcs.org
comments.raw_text:
I don't know.

I'm typing the first few characters of the address and pressing [ENTER]

What is the "Switch to tab" feature?

comments.creator: george.carstoiu@gmail.com
comments.author: george.carstoiu@gmail.com
comments.text: Switch-to-Tab: As you’re opening a new tab or typing in the Awesome Bar, Firefox will check to see if you already have that site open. If you do, you’ll be directed to the existing tab so you don’t open a duplicate.
comments.raw_text: Switch-to-Tab: As you’re opening a new tab or typing in the Awesome Bar, Firefox will check to see if you already have that site open. If you do, you’ll be directed to the existing tab so you don’t open a duplicate.

If I open a new tab and type the address in, that means I *want* a duplicate.

Okay, fine, thanks for the info.  Where's the option to turn this behaviour off?

Also, too late for me now, but we really should be *asking* users if they want to turn this feature on, lest we astonish anybody else.
comments.text:

comments.author: sutton@bcs.org
comments.creator: sutton@bcs.org

comments.raw_text:
Hello.

After opening a new tab and entering the first letters of a website that is already opened in another tab, a list of suggested websites will pop up. The first option from that list of suggestions is to switch to the tab that you already have opened. But you have other options as well, if you would like to open a duplicate of that website as well.

Do these explanations solve the problem?

I will set the status to Resolved WorksForMe. If you feel that there still is an issue here then please feel free to re-open it.
comments.text:
Hello.

After opening a new tab and entering the first letters of a website that is already opened in another tab, a list of suggested websites will pop up. The first option from that list of suggestions is to switch to the tab that you already have opened. But you have other options as well, if you would like to open a duplicate of that website as well.

Do these explanations solve the problem?

I will set the status to Resolved WorksForMe. If you feel that there still is an issue here then please feel free to re-open it.
comments.creator: virgil.dicu@softvision.ro
comments.author: virgil.dicu@softvision.ro

comments.raw_text:
Reopened.  I do NOT repeat NOT have other options.  The ONLY option is "switch to tab".

To clarify, I cannot have the same URL open in two different tabs when auto-completing in the address bar.  When I press [ENTER], the browser jumps to the existing window and closes the new tab.

The expected behaviour is to open the page in the current tab, not to jump to another tab.

Reproduced in:-
 Build identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:6.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/6.0

comments.text:
> Open a new tab.
> Start to type in address of site, until autocomplete found it
> Press [ENTER]

Note that you can hit Shift+Enter to disable the switch-to-tab behavior.
comments.raw_text:
> Open a new tab.
> Start to type in address of site, until autocomplete found it
> Press [ENTER]

Note that you can hit Shift+Enter to disable the switch-to-tab behavior.
comments.creator: dao+bmo@mozilla.com

comments.raw_text:

Is there any way to permanently disable this feature (or at least reverse it, so that switch-to-tab occurs only when [SHIFT] is pressed?)

comments.text:
(In reply to Steve Sutton from comment #11)
> Thank you, that helps :)
> 
> Is there any way to permanently disable this feature (or at least reverse
> it, so that switch-to-tab occurs only when [SHIFT] is pressed?)

No built in option, but there's https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/switch-to-tab-no-more/
